sources.title: Invitation To A Gunfighter (1964) Yul Brynner · George Segal
sources.description: A callous gunslinger in the post-Civil War era, thanks to the steadfastness of a woman in a dictatorially oppressed city, discovers human emotions and rediscovers his conscience.   Dressed as a Western, this is a plea for civic integrity and the overcoming of racial prejudice. The staging is a bit brittle and not entirely convincing.

metadata.Plot: When Confederate soldier Matt Weaver returns to town after the Civil War, he finds that his home has been sold by town boss Sam Brewster. Brewster hires gunfighter Jules Gaspard d'Estaing to deal with Weaver, but d'Estaing's independent approach settles the town's problems in a very unorthodox manner.
metadata.Writer: Alvin Sapinsley, Hal Goodman, Larry Klein
metadata.Actors: Yul Brynner, Janice Rule, George Segal
